snippet: There is no evidence that pelvic exams of healthy women are useful and plenty to suggest they provoke fear and pain, the American College of Physicians says.
abstract: American College of Physicians says in new practice guideline for doctors that there is no evidence that pelvic exams of healthy women are useful and plenty to suggest that the procedure provokes fear, anxiety and pain; guideline is published in the Annals of Internal Medicine and is accompanied by an article reviewing the scientific evidence.
lead_paragraph: There is no evidence that pelvic exams of healthy women are useful and plenty to suggest they provoke fear and pain, the American College of Physicians says.

headline.main: Guideline Calls Routine Pelvic Exams Unnecessary
headline.print_headline: Guideline Calls Routine Exams of the Pelvis Unnecessary

keywords.value: American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists
keywords.name: organizations
